summary.purpose: Global type definitions for text direction, state management, popup configuration, application names, and authentication methods.
summary.problem_solved: Provides reusable type definitions for common patterns across the application (RTL/LTR support, React state setters, modal/popup configuration, multi-app support).

exports.name: LoginOption
exports.description_one_line: Union type for login authentication methods.

symbols.name: Direction
symbols.description_one_line: Text direction type for RTL/LTR support.

details.what_it_does: Type alias for specifying text direction as either right-to-left (rtl) for Hebrew/Arabic or left-to-right (ltr) for English and most languages. Used throughout the app for layout and text rendering direction.

minimal_correct.title: Using Direction type
minimal_correct.code:
const direction: Direction = 'rtl'; // Hebrew or Arabic
const direction: Direction = 'ltr'; // English or most languages

extensive_correct.title: Direction-aware styling

symbols.name: SetState
symbols.description_one_line: Generic React state setter function type.

details.what_it_does: Generic type for React state setter functions. Accepts either a new value directly or an updater function that receives the previous state. Follows React's useState setter pattern.
details.type_definition: type SetState<T> = (updater: ((prev: T) => T) | T) => void;

minimal_correct.title: Using SetState type

extensive_correct.title: Custom hook with SetState

symbols.name: ModularPopUp
symbols.description_one_line: Popup/modal configuration with positioning and styling.

details.what_it_does: Union type representing either null (no popup) or an object configuring a popup/modal element with JSX content, positioning (top/left/bottom/right), background color, close handler, and element name identifier. Null indicates popup is closed/not displayed.

minimal_correct.title: Simple popup configuration

extensive_correct.title: Complete popup with async close handler

symbols.name: AppName
symbols.description_one_line: Union type for supported application names.

details.what_it_does: Union type specifying the three supported Akeyless applications: 'installer', 'toolbox', or 'dashboard'. Used to identify which app context is running or to configure app-specific behavior.

minimal_correct.title: Using AppName type

extensive_correct.title: App-specific feature routing

details.what_it_does: Union type specifying supported authentication methods: 'google' (OAuth via Google) or 'phone' (phone number verification). Used to determine which login flow to initiate.

minimal_correct.title: Login method selection
minimal_correct.code:
const selectedLogin: LoginOption = 'google';
const loginMethods: LoginOption[] = ['google', 'phone'];
